New Records: Adil Rashid took 4 wickets for 11 runs in his spell.
Mark Wood reached 50 T20I wickets with a dismissal in the match.
Key Match Events: England's bowlers dominated the powerplay, taking 4 wickets for 25 runs.
The match ended in 19 balls after the powerplay, with England winning by 8 wickets.
Adil Rashid had a remarkable spell with 20 dot-balls and 4 wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: England needed a quick win to improve their net run rate.
Jos Buttler decided to bowl first after the toss to chase a low target.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt and Will Jacks contributed with key performances.
The victory was seen as pivotal for England's tournament progress.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England achieved a quick finish with 101 balls remaining.
The scorecard showed Oman's low total and England's dominance.
Others: The match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
